Case reference: 2020016024.CaseDesc: In July of 2019, Anita Grace Wechsler was seen and heard from for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of Anita’s disappearance, she may have been despondent and involved in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2020013833.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2020, Dylan Ehler was seen for the last time as he wandered off in Truro, Nova Scotia. Following his disappearance, Dylan’s rubber boots were discovered in a nearby brook by divers. This brook flows into a river that flows with the Bay of Fundy.

Jacket: Dark Green, Camo with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2014001032.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1999, a man committed suicide in front of a train near Wellington Street on the Lachine Canal. He was found lying on the railroad tracks.

Mark: Left Knee, erosion of the knee
Right Knee, erosion of the knee

Case reference: 2013000081.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1995, John Kargakos was reported missing when he was last seen swimming by a neighbour in Lac St-Louis au bord de l'eau located in the Dorval district of Montreal, Quebec. John has Alzheimer’s disease.

Case reference: 2012020068.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1996 Winston Redhead's father reported that he had not heard from his son since December 21, 1995.  Winston's brother advised that Winston indicated he would be home for Christmas.  The last contact with Winston was made by staff at the Main Street Project in Winnipeg on December 26, 1995.  He told staff there that he would be going back up north. Winston has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020012524.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1993, at approximately 2:45pm, Lois Dunlavy was seen for the last time as she attended the Scarborough General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Lois had been examined by a physician and when the physician returned to check on her, she was gone.

Case reference: 2015011652.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1998, a ship from Lisbon arrived at the port of Montreal. The captain of the ship discovered the body of a man in the back part of the liner. The captain thinks it's a stowaway.

Case reference: 2014004485.CaseDesc: Pablo Guerra was reported missing by his family on May 10, 2004. He had no health issues. Pablo's jacket was located in a body of water under the Second Narrows Bridge by Vancouver City Police Marine Section the day Pablo was last seen.

Jacket: Black, North Face embroidered on left breast

Case reference: 2016012810.CaseDesc: On March 12th, 2016 shortly after midnight, Denny Poole and a friend left Dawson Creek with the intent of heading to Fort St John. It is unknown if they intended to walk, hitchhike, or had other means to get there. The duo became disoriented and ended up wandering the highway and back roads for over 20 hours. It was learned that neither of them was prepared to be out for this period of time. At some point, Denny and his friend had a difference of opinion on whether they should continue on their journey or not, and the two ended up separating. The last confirmed sighting of Denny was just south of the Kiskatinaw Bridge on Highway 97. Denny has some disabilities and it is recommended that he be under adult supervision.

Shoes: Black, Purple, green and white "Osiris" brand
Sweater: Grey, Dark grey hoodie with red "DGK" symbol

Case reference: 2014005441.CaseDesc: On April 23, 2010, Roland Enabulele was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roland had taken a trip to Spain and has last spoken with his ex-wife on May 3. During that conversation, Roland advised her that he would be returning to Toronto on May 5, but never returned.

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Shoes: Black, sandals; velcro straps; size 9; navy blue, grey and black swirls
Backpack: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Mountain Equipment Coop
Glasses: Bronze, octagon shaped, wire rimmed, prescription

Case reference: 2016061850.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1978, the body of a male was found in the snow on the east side of the Bayview Extension, near the east end of Labatt Ave, on the west bank of the Don River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Unshaven, beard and moustache
Pyjama: Blue, White, Blue and white patterned pyjama bottoms
Coat: Dark grey winter coat with a checkered pattern
Scarf: Black, blue and red plaid scarf
Shirt: Maroon, Black, Maroon and black sport shirt
Scar: Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars on a forearm
Abdomen, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Shoulders, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Mark: Left Hip, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Right Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Left Abdomen, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Right Leg, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Thigh, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
3 scabbed abrasions around the left eye orbit.

Case reference: 2006009699.CaseDesc: Dwayne Lee left his residence on December 24th,1999. His vehicle was located December 26, 1999, at Gray's Beach, Thousand Island's Parkway in the Township of Leeds and Thousand Islands.

Case reference: 2016061097.CaseDesc:
On June 18, 1979, the body of an unidentified male was found in the Detroit River near Riverside Drive and Crawford Avenue in the city of Windsor, Ontario. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. 
He is believed to have been in the water for 1 week to six months.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Moustache, possibly `Lamb Chop`style sideburns
Teeth: Unerupted wisdom teeth, which may have been impacted.

Case reference: 2005004099.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1999, this male was found in the Niagara River, near the Whirlpool. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is estimated to have been in the water for a few days at most.

Teeth: He had an upper denture and his lower teeth were in poor condition.
Socks: White, Beige, a single white and beige sock
Tattoo: Right Arm, "LINDA" in black ink with a heart above the letter "i", 12.5X4 cm

Case reference: 2006009099.CaseDesc: John Samuel Clifford was last seen on October 10, 1987. He was fishing and hunting near Floods Landing, on Frederickshouse River, in the Township of Blount, District of Cochrane. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate him.

Boots: Rubber, Green, Red, construction safety boots
Coat: Wool, Green, Parka, hydro work jacket

Case reference: 2014001087.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2001, a woman was found dead near the Allan Memorial Pavilion at the Royal Victoria Hospital in Montreal. With the help of a forensic artist, a face reconstruction was made. The woman wore gray clothes similar to those used by hospital patients.

Shoes: White, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, "Aerocourt" running shoes brand, size 8

Case reference: 2015018154.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1966, Delores Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014006316.CaseDesc: Andrew William Munro was last seen in Stewart, British Columbia on November 15, 2013. Police and family are concerned for his well being as he needs daily medication. He may be clean shaven or have a goatee. Mr. Munro may have been crossing the border between British Columbia and Alaska. Mr. Munro was a long time lower mainland resident who had recently moved to Stewart, to pursue a career in the logging industry.

Hair: Brown, Short, Sometimes has a goatee.

Case reference: 2014001591.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1997, Gordon Mertz was seen for the last time at the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) on East White Hills road in St. John's, Newfoundland. Gordon worked as a Fisheries Scientist, and records show that he logged off of his computer and left the building shortly after 5:15 p.m.

Case reference: 2014005482.CaseDesc: Shaun Chris MacDonald-McLaughlin was reported missing on March 27, 2010 by his step-father. Shaun was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2010, in Vancouver, British Columbia when he packed his belongings and stated he was going home. Shaun was known to have substance abuse problems and was diagnosed as a paranoid-schizophrenic.

Case reference: 2018053566.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1995, at approximately 8:30am, Robert Walmsley was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Robert was scheduled to meet with his sister the following day, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2014002350.CaseDesc: On May 29th, 1990 Pierre Beaudoin left his residence in Hebron, Prince Edward Island. Police later confirmed that Mr. Beaudoin stayed at the Hotel Francis in New Richmond, Quebec and was seen for the last time on May 31, 1990, when he checked out of the hotel. Pierre’s truck and personal belongings were found in a dense, wooded area approximately 45 miles southeast of Route 275 in Balmoral, New Brunswick on August 17th, 1990.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020158.CaseDesc: This adult male was witnessed collapsing in the 400 block of Powell Street in East Vancouver. He was pronounced dead upon arrival to hospital.

Case reference: 2014001485.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Mohamad Daher was seen for the last time as he left his residence, in the Anjou district in Montreal, Quebec, for a business meeting. His vehicle was found at Le Boulevard Shopping Centre in the Saint-Leonard neighbourhood. Mohamad has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002329.CaseDesc: Blair Henry Yensen left his residence in the town of Capreol on January 7th, 1992. He was last seen walking on Ski Hill Road. He has a noticeable limp, walks with a cane and has a shoe insert in his left shoe. He smokes very heavily. He suffers from severe depression, seems to be quite religious, and speaks in a religious manner.

Jacket: Fishing Jacket, blue with yellow and gold lettering on the front and back.

Case reference: 2014004899.CaseDesc: Claude Barbier was last seen on November 16, 1996, with his girlfriend at the Cooke residence in Trois-Rivières. On November 18, 1996, the body of his girlfriend was pulled from the St-Lawrence River near St-Antoine-de-Tilly. Mr. Barbier has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014026082.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2014, Francois Montcalm was seen for the last time when he left the family residence riding his vintage blue Peugeot Bicycle.

Case reference: 2020011478.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1988, Mary McCarthy was seen for the last time at her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Mary’s vehicle was later found on November 17, 1988 at the bus depot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mary was a chartered accountant working for CSA Management Ltd. at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020052.CaseDesc: Marilyn Byskal went missing on June 20, 1974, while on a school organized canoe trip. She was last seen at her tent when everyone first woke up in the morning. Most present at the camp felt that Miss Byskal fell into the fast flowing waters of the Grass River, however no one witnessed this. An extensive 10 day water and ground search was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2016059837.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2001, a male was found in the Detroit River, near 4200 block on Sandwich Street. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 138 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water a few days to a few months.

Hair: Short curly black hair on the left side of face
Teeth: Full gold crown on the lower left second molar
Jewelry: Braided, unknown if anklet or bracelet
Gold, Ears, Clear stone stud earrings
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Right Little Finger, 2 rings
Shirt: Black, Hooded sweatshirt with "Providence Friars" written on the front
Shorts: Blue, Gold, "Champion" brand short with the "University of Michigan" logo

Case reference: 2014032043.CaseDesc:
On May 22nd, 1970, Philomena Sisson, age 68, was reported missing by her son, Harry Jack.  She had gone missing a few days earlier from his house on Boys Rd. in Duncan, BC.  Mrs. Sisson was reported to be an alcoholic who occasionally went missing for several days at a time. She also suffered from dementia. 
 
Mrs. Sisson's last surviving son has since passed away.  There was never any indication of foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001079.CaseDesc: On June 5, 1986, the skeletal remains of an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 18-29, were found in a wooded area near Hollyburn Mountain in Cypress Provincial Park in West Vancouver British-Columbia. He was likely not from the region and may have went missing between 1984 and 1985. He carried a small figure of Jurojin, an ancient Japanese god of fortune, and had a photo of the Buddha in his wallet. He would be about 60 years old today.

Jacket: Grey, HOODED, Hooded with front zipper

Case reference: 2014005423.CaseDesc: On January 22, 1971, Maryse Chalette was seen for the last time when she went out for a walk at approximately 12:30 p.m., in the Joliette area in Quebec. Maryse was placed in foster care by the CHRDL Hospital.

Case reference: 2011005799.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2011 Ibrahim Sendaigre was driving on Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Marathon, Ontario.  He was involved in a motor vehicle accident and fled the scene into the bush area. Police searches of the area yielded negative results. Mr. Sendaigre has not been located and has had no contact with family or friends. Last Seen: Highway 17, Tuuri Township.  Approximately 4 km west of the Steel River bridge near Black Fox Lake.  This area is essentially located between the towns of Marathon and Terrace Bay, in Northwestern Ontario.

Case reference: 2019059679.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2017, the skeletal remains of an older man were found in a homeless encampment along Grandview Highway in Vancouver, British Columbia. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains. Residents claimed that he had been there for several years, and went by the name Gordon. He was a small man, who had fractured his nose at some point in his past, and was known to eat a lot of Cheddar Jalapeno Cheetos.

Jeans: Blue, KIRKLAND, Yellow and blue rope tied around waist

Case reference: 2018038616.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2018, Cameron Richard Betker was reported missing by family.

Case reference: 2014005870.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, André Bellemare was last seen by his wife at his residence in Trois-Rivières, QC. On May 24, 2012, Mr. Bellemare’s vehicle was found abandoned in the woods near the ZEC Tawachiche territory, located in the municipality of Lac-aux-Sables. Despite the discovery of the vehicle, so far the searches have been unsuccessful in locating Mr. Bellemare.

Shoes: Brown, Size 10, Treking North Face brand
Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Plaid, size XL

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2017029343.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2017, Patrick Wall was last seen at his home in Wetaskiwin County, Alberta. His abandoned vehicle was located in Edmonton, also in Alberta.

Case reference: 2005004399.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1998, the remains of an unidentified man were found while cleaning out the intake to the Sir Adam Beck Hydro Generating Station. A single bone was all that was recovered. He is believed to have been in the water for many months to many years.

Case reference: 2014001214.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2012, the skeleton of a woman was discovered on the banks of the Rivière des Prairies, on the south side of Montreal near Gouin Street.

Case reference: 2020007642.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1971, Ethel Crespo was last seen by her husband in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Ethel was two months pregnant.

Case reference: 2006011099.CaseDesc: Kenneth Richard Wolfe was working on Caribou Lake, (15 km north west of Armstrong, Ontario). On October 8, 1970, he left alone in a 16 foot steel boat to work on a dock. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Wolfe.

Case reference: 2016069147.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1974, the body of a Caucasian male was found on the CNR tracks, 200 yards west of the CNR Station, Hearst. A witness observed the remains on the tracks after an advancing train had passed. His post-mortem length was recorded as being 5’8” however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was described as having a medium build. He may have been wearing glasses according to police reports.

Teeth: Good, Missing upper left 3rd molar. Several of his upper and lower posterior teeth had amalgam restorations.

Case reference: 2008015199.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1978, Alison Mary Thomas was visiting her boyfriend in Toronto Ontario. Shortly after midnight she left his residence walking towards Yonge Street, Toronto. Alison Thomas had indicated that she was going to get a taxi cab to take her to her residence, but she never arrived. An extensive investigation was conducted by the Toronto Police Service, but to this day, Alison Thomas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2013000052.CaseDesc: Denis Lapensée was last seen on May 28, 1998, in Montreal and was reported missing on June 2, 1998. Mr. Lapensée suffers from schizophrenia and was very depressed following a breakup with his spouse. He has previously mentioned that he intends to throw himself off the Jacques Cartier Bridge. M. Lapensée has bad dentition, is right-handed and smokes a pipe.

Hat: White, toque, blue and red polka dot

Case reference: 2006017399.CaseDesc: Mary Frances Gregory left her home in Parry Sound, Ontario on February 15, 1978, to vacation in California. She failed to arrive at her destination in Palo Alto, California and has not contacted any family members or friends since. Ms. Gregory is believed to have departed Canada by motor vehicle with a male acquaintance who states that he let her off at a bus station in Las Vegas, Nevada some ten days after leaving Canada. The driver claims to have driven to Nevada via the States of New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Illinois, Colorado, Utah, and Arizona.

Mark: Right Abdomen, Brown, in shape of 5 cent piece (10mm)

Case reference: 2016061152.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1990, a male was found in the Detroit River, in LaSalle. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for approximately two months.

Socks: White, blue and red horizontal rings at top
Suit: Wool, Maroon, two-piece jogging suit with no pockets

Case reference: 2014002305.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Dennis Howe was seen for the last time at his place of work at 333 Spadina Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008007999.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, Charles Leslie Lewis and a friend were out fishing on Gull Rock Lake approximately 10km south of Red Lake. While they were out on the lake the winds picked up and began to create large waves, which caused the boat to capsize. Mr. Lewis and his friend clung to the bottom of the boat but were pushed off several times by the waves. Mr. Lewis was washed away from the boat. As he attempted to swim back to the boat, his head kept going under water.  At one point he did not resurface.

Jacket: Canvas, Brown, Orange, Hunting - ONG shoulder patches

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014005576.CaseDesc: Daniel Dumigan's family lost contact with him in July of 1975. They received information that he was planning to leave for Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2006008399.CaseDesc: Joseph Niro last contacted his daughter by telephone on June 02, 1999. He was last seen on June 20, 1999.

Hair: Black, Long, Wavy, Parted to the right

Case reference: 2017062421.CaseDesc: Matthew Wiinikainen was seen for the last time on March 30, 1995 in Gaspé, Quebec. Matthew was in detention at the Youth Center “Unité La Rade”, located in Gaspé hospital area, Quebec. He escaped around 11:00 p.m. during the change of the guard.

Case reference: 2015026912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2015, Kandice Singbeil was seen for the last time by her boyfriend in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2006004699.CaseDesc: On 13 July 1992, William Aman left the shore of Lake Ontario to go fishing.  His boat was later found with his ball cap 3.2 kilometers off of Pete's Point, Lake Ontario. Mr. Aman has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020182.CaseDesc: This male was recovered from the shoreline at Pilothouse Road, West Vancouver.

Case reference: 2014001691.CaseDesc: Norman Krolman was last seen withdrawing money from an ATM machine.  He was a self-employed computer programmer and was in business with a partner.  He had a steady girlfriend and a small circle of friends.

Case reference: 2016066830.CaseDesc:
On June 13, 1967, the remains of a male were discovered in the Detroit River at the Canada Steamship Dock, at the foot of Prospect Street. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
He is thought to have been dead for several months.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown with a few grey hairs
Shirt: Dark Blue, Dark blue sport shirt, size 15-15 1/2, Made in Canada
Sweater: Brown, Cardigan sweater labeled "Knit to Fit";
Suit: Dark Blue, Double-breasted suit with a faint dark stripe
Boots: Black, Hiking-type boots, size nine, "Pathfinder" brand

Case reference: 2014004558.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Rodolfo Morales was last heard from when he spoke to his friend over the telephone.

Case reference: 2014003746.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1972, Mario Cardinal was reported missing by his family. At the time of his disappearance, he lived in Trois-Rivières, Quebec.

Case reference: 2008006699.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1967, Stanley Sczcygiel was fishing on the Berens River with two other Americans.  All three were swept over the falls.  The other two men survived, however Mr. Sczcygiel is presumed to have drowned.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014004103.CaseDesc: Michelle Gurney was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver at the St. James Community Society building on December 11, 1998. She was reported missing ten days later. Ms. Gurney was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and had mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014005430.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2010, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Isaiah Lai was last seen attending church in Toronto, Ontario. Isaiah was visiting Canada on a student visa.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2008002599.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1991, William Caswell and his daughter were boating on Panache Lake when they were both suddenly thrown into the water. Mr. Caswell's daughter managed to swim ashore but William is still missing and is presumed drowned. Panache Lake is located east of Espanola and West of Sudbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2014004874.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2006, Tracy Forde was seen for the last time at her home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008002899.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1998 Melvin Spence, an offshore laborer, left the farm he was employed at and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018040276.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1992, at approximately 12:00pm, Luom Truong was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to leaving his home, Luom and his mother had an argument.

Case reference: 2014004460.CaseDesc: Tsuguo Moroto left his place of business in Banff and rented a car on July 21, 1985. Several days later the vehicle was located at Panther Falls on Highway 93 North near Lake Louise, Alberta.  Several ground, aerial and waterway searches were conducted without success. Mr. Moroto was never located.

Case reference: 2014003020.CaseDesc: On October 7, 1997, Judy Desjarlais and a friend were sitting outside of their shared residence on Cameron Ave, Edmonton, overlooking the North Saskatchewan River. Judy took off running down towards the river. Her friend heard Judy in the river calling for help and went into the water looking for her.

Scar: Chin, Noticeable scar on left chin
Mark: Chin, Mole on left side of chin
Waist, 2 moles, 1 on each side of the stomach

Case reference: 2006015499.CaseDesc: Richard Ranger was last seen on March 4, 1999, at Buster's Confectionary on Main Street in Haileybury.  Richard had been admitted to the Temiskaming Hospital for psychiatric assessment the same day he went missing and may suffer from mental illness. His whereabouts are unknown and foul play is not suspected at this time.

Case reference: 2012020115.CaseDesc: Glen Moquin was last seen at a summer camp in Abitibi on August 9th, 1993.  His clothes were located on the shore of the lake.

Case reference: 2020011563.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1988, at approximately 12:00pm, Mosses Korman was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001106.CaseDesc: A partial skull belonging to an adult male was found in a remote area, located approximately 40 km southeast of Prince George, British Columbia. He has at least one solid gold crown in his teeth that may have been visible when he smiled. It is believed he was deceased for 2-5 years prior to the skull being recovered.

Case reference: 2013000121.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2012, human remains were located near Cochrane, Alberta. The Calgary Medical Examiner has determined that the remains are those of a white man between the ages of 20 and 60 years old.  The remains had been decomposing for less than a year prior to being discovered.  This man had once suffered a broken nose that had healed.

Case reference: 2015059337.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2015, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Van Huong was last seen on vacation in Vietnam. The next morning, Van’s family noticed he had left the hotel room and had not returned.

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014004201.CaseDesc: Rodney Hicks was last seen at his residence at 1700hrs on March 3, 1989. Mr. Hicks has an intellectual disability. He suffered from epilepsy and autism.

Case reference: 2009004299.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1973, Madeleine Van Overdijk was reported missing by her husband.  She was last seen at her residence in Brantford, Ontario. Information reported to police suggested she was going to Toronto.  It is unknown if in fact she made it to Toronto.

Case reference: 2014004681.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1965, Archie Laroque was hunting with six other people near Laroque Lake, 48 kilometers east of Carrot River, SK. The hunting party split up and Archie was last seen walking in an area alone. Extensive ground and air searches were conducted, however, Archie was never located.

Case reference: 2012020080.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2004, at 11:30 p.m., Courtney Struble, 13 years old, was last seen walking towards her residence in Estevan, SK. There have been reported sightings of Courtney, however, despite investigations and searches, she has not been located.

Mark: Neck, birthmark at nape of neck

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2020011537.CaseDesc: On February 11, 1985, Veronica Butch was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Veronica had moved out of the apartment that she shared with her boyfriend and she was supposed to move in with her sister, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2014003280.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1998, Peter Dekoning was reported missing after failing to return home from making his restaurant deliveries. He was last seen at Jackfish Lake near Two Hills where he was believed to have stayed for several days. His vehicle was located near the North Saskatchewan river with the keys missing. There was no sign of foul play. A search of land and water was unsuccessful.

Pants: Dark Blue, Black, pants were either dark blue or black
Scar: Jaw, long white scar down right side of chin

Case reference: 2014003424.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1992, Marie Trahan was last seen in Petit-Shippagan, New Brunswick.  Marie's abandoned vehicle was later located at the wharf.

Case reference: 2022011021.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2022, Nicholas Adamson was seen for the last time walking away from an establishment in the area of Sullivan Avenue and Front Street South in Thorold, Ontario.

Shirt: White, BUTTON UP, Short sleeve button up
Tattoo: Left Chest, Head of a wolf

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020017914.CaseDesc: In January of 1983, Helen King was seen for the last time at the Woodbine Community Centre in Toronto, Ontario where she had been a volunteer. Helen is known for living a transient lifestyle and has had no contact with family or friends since this time.

Case reference: 2009005499.CaseDesc: Joanne Foley was last seen in May of 1989, when she was staying with friends in Port McNicoll, Ontario.  She had mentioned that she was planning on going to western Canada, but there is no indication that she travelled there.  She has had no contact with friends or relatives since May 1989.

Case reference: 2012020011.CaseDesc: Daniel Richard McCallum was living in the Lillooet, BC area up until October 2008.  When his family hadn't heard from him for some time, they reported him missing. There are unconfirmed reports that he may have moved away, but police have been unable to determine his whereabouts. His disappearance is considered suspicious.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, scorpio sign with "Dan" written inside

Case reference: 2013000016.CaseDesc: Marjorie Ferris was reported missing when she did not show up in London, Ontario, where she was to visit friends. Her apartment was found secured and intact with her purse inside. Her vehicle was parked in the underground garage at her building. Extensive investigation failed to uncover any information regarding her disappearance.

Teeth: False, Full upper and lower dentures

Case reference: 2014003073.CaseDesc: Michael Hammond was last seen on November 24, 1991 at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020037.CaseDesc: Mr. Old Shoes' last known whereabouts are that he was camping on the Blood Reserve Timber limits area located between Waterton Lakes National Park and the Chief Mountain Border Crossing. He was last seen on April 1, 2001.
